item.title: 日本游客挥霍无度令奢侈品牌头疼不已
item.description: 由于日元汇率疲软，游客纷纷涌向日本，以折扣价购买高档服装和手袋。路易威登母公司路威酩轩集团（LVMH）等奢侈品公司却希望他们留在国内购物。【原文：Tourists are flocking to Japan to scoop up high-end clothes and handbags at a discount thanks to the weak yen currency. Luxury goods companies like Louis Vuitton parent LVMH would rather they stayed home and shopped.】

item.title: 丰田第一季度营业利润增长 17%，符合预期
item.description: 丰田汽车公司周四表示，该公司第一季度营业利润增长了 17%，原因是日本汽车制造商降低成本的努力和日元疲软抵消了日本国内销售和产量的下降。【原文：Toyota Motor said on Thursday it posted a 17% rise in first-quarter operating profit, as the Japanese automaker got a boost from cost reduction efforts and the weak yen that helped offset lower sales and production volume in Japan.】

item.title: 早间竞价：市场看好英国央行
item.description: Stella Qiu 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Stella Qiu】

item.title: 全球经济 中国工厂不景气拖累亚洲制造商
item.description: 周四的民间调查显示，中国制造业活动的下滑导致上个月亚洲工厂普遍表现疲软，因为企业主们都在努力应对不温不火的需求，这增加了该地区经济复苏动力不足的风险。【原文：A slump in China's manufacturing activity led a generally weak performance for Asia's factories last month as business owners grappled with tepid demand, private surveys showed on Thursday, raising risks of an underpowered economic recovery in the region.】

item.title: 亚洲股市延续全球涨势，日经指数因日元飙升而一枝独秀
item.description: 受 Meta 和 Nvidia 帮助，全球科技股大幅反弹，亚洲股市周四也随之上扬，而美国即将放松政策的前景则提振了全球债券和大宗商品。【原文：Asian shares rallied on Thursday, tracking a huge revival in global tech stocks helped by Meta and Nvidia, while prospects of imminent policy easing in the U.S. boosted global bonds and commodities.】

item.title: 财新PMI显示中国工厂活动9个月来首次收缩
item.description: 周四的一项私营部门调查显示，由于新订单减少，中国7月份的制造业活动出现了九个月来的首次萎缩，这预示着中国2024年下半年的增长势头不容乐观。【原文：China's manufacturing activity in July shrank for the first time in nine months as new orders declined, a private sector survey showed on Thursday, boding ill for the country's growth momentum in the second half of 2024.】

item.title: 派拉蒙全球公司的神秘竞标者引发质疑
item.description: 一位熟悉此事的消息人士告诉路透社，参与评估派拉蒙全球公司收购要约的各方对 Apex Capital Trust 收购该公司的合法性提出了质疑。【原文：Parties involved in evaluating offers for Paramount Global have raised questions about the legitimacy of Apex Capital Trust's bid for the company, one source familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 美联储暗示降息在即，美元止跌回升；日元坚挺
item.description: 在美联储为 9 月份降息敞开大门后，美元周四走软，在日本央行鹰派立场的影响下，日元继续维持在 3 月份以来的最高点附近。【原文：The U.S. dollar was soft on Thursday after the Federal Reserve opened the door for an interest rate cut in September, helping keep the yen pinned near its highest since March in the wake of a hawkish pivot from the Bank of Japan.】

item.title: 中东冲突扩大的风险导致石油上涨
item.description: 周四亚市早盘，油价上涨，延续了上一交易日的强劲涨势，此前哈马斯一名领导人在伊朗被杀，引发了更广泛中东冲突的威胁，而且有迹象表明美国石油需求强劲。【原文：Oil prices rose in early Asian trading on Thursday, extending strong gains in the previous session after the killing of a Hamas leader in Iran raised the threat of a wider Middle East conflict and on signs of strong oil demand in the U.S.】

item.title: 韩国 7 月出口以六个月来最快速度增长
item.description: 周四的贸易数据显示，韩国 7 月份出口增长速度为六个月来最快，但低于市场预期。【原文：South Korea's exports rose in July at the fastest pace in six months but missed market expectations, trade data showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 新加坡吉宝兴业利润增长，得益于基础设施和互联互通的良好表现
item.description: Singapore's Keppel Ltd posted on Thursday a 7% rise in its first-half underlying profit, as upbeat performances at the infrastructure and connectivity segments offset a decline in its real estate business.

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，马斯克的 xAI 考虑收购 Character.AI
item.description: 据 The Information 周三报道，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的人工智能初创公司 xAI 考虑收购聊天机器人初创公司 Character.AI，以寻找更多方法来测试其 Grok 人工智能模型。【原文：Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup xAI has considered acquiring chatbot startup Character.AI as it looks for more ways to test its Grok AI models, The Information reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 新加坡大华银行第二季度净利润增长 1%，低于预期
item.description: 新加坡大华银行（UOB）周四公布，由于净手续费收入增加、贷款相关费用和财富管理费用回升，第二季度净利润同比增长 1%。【原文：Singapore's United Overseas Bank (UOB) reported on Thursday a 1% rise in net profit in the second quarter from a year earlier on the back of higher net fee income and a rebound in loan-related fees and wealth management fees.】

item.title: 文件显示，23andMe首席执行官沃西基提出将公司私有化的提议
item.description: 周三的一份文件显示，23andMe 联合创始人兼首席执行官安妮-沃西基（Anne Wojcicki）向董事会提出了一项不具约束力的建议，即以每股 0.40 美元的价格收购该公司尚未由她或她的关联公司持有的所有流通股。【原文：23andMe co-founder and chief executive Anne Wojcicki made a non-binding proposal to the board to acquire all of the company's outstanding shares not already owned by her or her affiliates for $0.40 per share, a filing showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 受人工智能热潮推动，Lam Research 预计季度收入将超过预期
item.description: 芯片制造工具供应商林姆研究公司（Lam Research）周三预计，九月份的营收将高于华尔街预期，预计在人工智能热潮的推动下，芯片公司的订单将激增。【原文：Chip-making tools supplier Lam Research forecast September quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, anticipating a surge in orders from chip firms amid the AI boom.】

item.title: 巴西一如预期维持利率，标榜 "更加谨慎"
item.description: 巴西央行周三在连续第二次政策会议上一如预期维持利率不变，并表示由于通胀预期恶化和近期市场波动，需要对货币政策 "提高警惕"。【原文：Brazil's central bank on Wednesday kept interest rates unchanged at a second consecutive policy meeting, as expected, flagging a need for "more vigilance" with monetary policy due to worsening inflation expectations and recent market swings.】

item.title: 大都会人寿第二季度利润超预期，团体福利部门表现强劲
item.description: 大都会人寿周三公布的第二季度利润好于预期，主要得益于其团体福利部门的强劲表现。【原文：MetLife reported a better-than-expected second-quarter profit on Wednesday, driven by strong performance in its group benefits unit.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔拒绝接受政治影响政策选择的观点
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周三表示，政治因素在近期货币政策审议或央行的长期预测工作中都不起作用。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Wednesday political considerations play no part in either near-term monetary policy deliberations or the central bank's longer-run forecasting work.】

item.title: 保险商 Aflac 因美国保费增长，季度利润超出预期
item.description: 人寿和健康保险公司 Aflac 周三公布的第二季度利润高于分析师的预期，主要得益于其美国部门保费收入的增长。【原文：Life and health insurer Aflac reported second-quarter profit above analysts' estimates on Wednesday, helped by higher premiums earned in its U.S. unit.】

item.title: 早间竞标：非同寻常的反弹席卷所有市场
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 雪佛龙公司称圭亚那仲裁听证会将于 5 月开始
item.description: 美国石油巨头雪佛龙公司（Chevron）周三表示，有关赫斯公司圭亚那资产的仲裁听证会已定于 2025 年 5 月举行。【原文：U.S. oil major Chevron said on Wednesday that hearing for an arbitration regarding Hess' Guyana assets have been scheduled for May 2025.】

item.title: 个性化礼品需求稳定，Etsy 季度收入超预期
item.description: Etsy 周三公布的第二季度营收和商品销售总额超出华尔街预期，主要得益于其在线市场对个性化礼品的稳定需求。【原文：Etsy beat Wall Street expectations for second-quarter revenue and gross merchandise sales on Wednesday, helped by steady demand for personalized gifts at its online marketplace.】

item.title: CrowdStrike 因巨大软件故障遭股东起诉
item.description: CrowdStrike公司被股东起诉，称这家网络安全公司隐瞒了其软件测试不足可能导致7月19日全球800多万台电脑瘫痪的原因，从而欺骗了他们。【原文：CrowdStrike has been sued by shareholders who said the cybersecurity company defrauded them by concealing how its inadequate software testing could cause the July 19 global outage that crashed more than 8 million computers.】

item.title: 锂价格下跌促使 Albemarle 进行新一轮成本削减
item.description: 全球最大的锂生产商阿尔伯马尔公司（Albemarle）周三表示，该公司今年将第二次削减成本，除股息外，其他一切都可能被砍掉。【原文：Albemarle , the world's largest lithium producer, said on Wednesday it would slash costs for the second time this year and that everything but its dividend could be on the chopping block.】

item.title: 美国航空公司跃跃欲试推出高级座椅
item.description: 高端旅游的需求正在蓬勃发展，美国的航空公司正急于抓住这一机遇。【原文：Demand for high-end travel is booming, and U.S. carriers are in a rush to seize on it.】

item.title: 因澳门业务复苏，赌场运营商米高梅第二季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 美高梅国际酒店集团（MGM Resorts International）周三公布的第二季度业绩超过了华尔街的预期，这主要得益于去年大流行病相关限制放宽后澳门经济的强劲复苏。【原文：MGM Resorts International beat Wall Street's second-quarter estimates on Wednesday, thanks to a strong recovery in Macau following the easing of pandemic-related restrictions last year.】

item.title: 波音 737 MAX 坠机事故家属称飞机制造商应面临更高的罚款
item.description: 在两起致命的波音 737 MAX 飞机坠毁事故中遇难的 346 人中的一些人的家属周三表示，美国法官应拒绝该飞机制造商与司法部达成的认罪协议，并称政府应寻求更高的罚款。【原文：Families for some of the 346 people killed in two fatal Boeing 737 MAX crashes said on Wednesday a U.S. judge should reject the planemaker's proposed plea deal with the Justice Department and said the government should seek a much higher fine.】

item.title: Cognizant 上调全年收入预期，第二季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 本周三，Cognizant Technology Solutions 上调了全年营收预期，第二季度业绩超过预期，主要得益于企业转向这家 IT 服务提供商以实现数字化运营。【原文：Cognizant Technology Solutions raised its annual revenue forecast and and beat second-quarter results estimates on Wednesday, aided by businesses turning to the IT services provider to digitize their operations.】

item.title: 随着人工智能竞赛的白热化，亚马逊将加入大科技公司支出激增的行列
item.description: 亚马逊公司预计将于本周四加入谷歌和微软的行列，报告人工智能方面的资本支出激增，因为大型科技公司急于利用这一蓬勃发展的技术。【原文：Amazon.com is expected to join Google and Microsoft on Thursday in reporting a surge in capital spending on artificial intelligence as Big Tech companies rush to capitalize on the booming technology.】

item.title: Corteva 季度利润超出预期
item.description: 美国农用化学品公司 Corteva 周三公布的第二季度利润超出预期，主要得益于种子价格的强劲上涨。【原文：U.S. agrichemicals firm Corteva beat second-quarter profit estimates on Wednesday, helped by strong prices for its seeds.】
